job description:
Ensuring Chart’s Success…

Assist in the technical aspects of assuring Chart products meet all code and regulatory requirements as well as meet or exceed customer expectations related to function and product quality.

What Your Day-to-Day Activities Will Be…
  • Participate in the development of quality management system to ensure compliance to ISO 9001, 14001 and OHS 18001 & other regulatory requirements.
  • Participate in product & process review to ensure compliance with applicable industrial standards & codes.
  • Participate in risk analysis, product and process quality planning, quality performance, non-conformance prevention and root cause corrective actions.
  • Conduct internal and/or external assessments of Quality Management Systems, prepare and write audit reports and conduct verification activities.
  • Develops and maintain key metrics on product and process performance
  • Drive continuous improvement actions based on the data compiled
  • Assist on containment and associated corrective actions on internal or external product non-conformities
Your Professional Experience Should Be…
  • 3-5 years of Quality Assurance, Quality Engineering or Quality Compliance in a manufacturing environment
  • Experience in the documentation, implementation, and maintenance of ISO-9001 and other quality management systems
  • Knowledge of related codes and standards – such as ISO 9001, AAR, ASME etc.
  • Familiar with FMEA, CAPA, Lean and other quality engineering/assurance techniques
  • Skills in successfully working with multi-functional departments to achieve desired results
  • Effective in using MS Office Software programs (such as MS Word, Excel, Access, etc.) for data collection, analysis, and report generation
  • Detail oriented, with a drive to meet or exceed internal & external customer requirements
Your Education Should Be…
  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering (ME, IE, QE)
Your Physical Work Environment Will Require…
  • This position will require the ability to move around the production floor
  • Lift up to 15 pounds
  • Sitting, standing, stooping, bending, other related tasks in an office setting
  • Some travel as needed
Chart is an equal opportunity employer
